newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Rebhold buys three companies for 61 mln.
newsitem.headline: Rebhold buys three companies for 61 mln.

text.p: Rebhold has bought three businesses in the food, freight and liquor sectors for 61 million rand.
It said in a statement on Wednesday that the businesses were Cape-based freight forwarder Trans Global, Gauteng-based McFoods and Cape-based Boland Wine.
"All these businesses are well-managed, niche businesses and in each case there is an existing relationship with the Rebhold group," chief executive Jacques Kempen said.
The acquisitions would be financed through the issue of a maximum of 11.4 million shares in up to three tranches.
The company said the pro forma effect of the acquisitions on earnings per share would be a 31 percent or nine cent increase to 38 cents a share based on a set of assumptions.
These were that earnings for the year to June 30, 1997 would amount to 29 cents a share and that the acquisition had been effective in the year to June 30, 1997.
Also that the acquisitions, together with that of HoneyFields announced in February, achieved profits warranted by the vendors for the period July 1, 1997 to June 30, 1998.
